state_analysis: The attempts to check the import of RDKit using Python 3.11 have failed repeatedly due to a shell error related to the use of the exclamation mark in the print statement. This suggests that the shell is misinterpreting the command due to special characters, which is preventing the command from executing successfully.
explanation: I will escape the exclamation mark in the print statement to avoid the shell issue. After confirming that RDKit can be imported successfully, I will run the solution_chem_agent.py script again to check if it works correctly without any errors.

commands.keystrokes: python3.11 -c "from rdkit import Chem; print('RDKit imported successfully!')"
